 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 2.4 - NAVIGABLE
PAGE TITLED(LEVEL A)
On accessible websites...

Web pages have titles that describe topic or purpose. 

These websites...

Provide ways to help users navigate, find content, and determine where they are.

WHAT'S AN EXAMPLE?
 An HTML Web page 

The descriptive title of an HTML Web page is marked up with the <title> element
so that it will be displayed in the title bar of the user agent. 

I still don't really understand
[https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/page-titled.html#examples] Web
Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.2, W3C World Wide Web Consortium
Recommendation 27 February 2020 (https://www.w3.org/TR/2020/WD-WCAG22-20200227/,
Latest version at https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG22/)
